result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence J. Meadows was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clarence J. Meadows is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clarence J. Meadows was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Clarence J. Meadows was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Ct.1 and consecutive to 15CM2416 and 15CM1416.

Motion to vacate DNA surcharge; filed by deft.
Revoked - Sentenced to Prison  kmk
Cts.3&4 - Dismissed  kmk
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Sanders.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes and stays sentence of 36 months WSP consecutive to 15CM2416 & 15CM1416; 18 months initial confinement; 18 months extended supervision w/conditions; deft is placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions; on ct 2 the court imposes and stays sentence of 9 months incarceration consecutive to ct 1 and consecutive to 15CM2416 & 15CM1416, deft placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions concurrent to ct 1; deft to pay $450 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs from 15CM1353.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Sanders.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 3 & 4 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 3/31/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Sanders.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Sanders states he has received an offer from the State, would like more time to discuss it with his client.  STC set for 1/27/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Sanders.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Phan states they are still negotiating.  Atty Sanders states he has not received an offer yet.  DA PTC 12/18/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 1/6/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Sanders the FPT of 12/9/15 at 8:15am is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 12/15/15 at 8:15am .

Defendant Clarence J. Meadows appeared with Attorney Jason Sanders.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.
